english: eater; consumer; person (who does X); -er suffix

etymology.description: 食 (eat/food) + 者 (nominalizer 'one who') = eater; person who eats; consumer.
etymology.interpretation: Uses the classical X者 pattern that turns a verb into “one who does X,” so 食者 is literally “one who eats.” In modern contexts it can extend to consumers or beneficiaries in food-related discourse.

examples.chinese: 肉食者鄙(肉食者鄙)，未能远谋(未能遠謀)。
examples.pinyin: ròu shí zhě bǐ, wèi néng yuǎn móu.
examples.english: Meat-eaters are petty and cannot plan far ahead.

examples.chinese: 对食者而言(對食者而言)，成分表越清晰越好(成分表越清晰越好)。
examples.pinyin: duì shí zhě ér yán, chéngfèn biǎo yuè qīngxī yuè hǎo.
examples.english: For eaters/consumers, the clearer the ingredient list, the better.

examples.chinese: 这款产品的主要食者是儿童(這款產品的主要食者是兒童)。
examples.pinyin: zhè kuǎn chǎnpǐn de zhǔyào shí zhě shì értóng.
examples.english: The primary eaters of this product are children.
